attributes.action: include recommendation 58 of the Pitt report on the list of urgent recommendations requiring action for this report
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since the publication of the Pitt report little action seems to have been taken in resolving potential risks to life from unsafe reservoirs and large bodies of water. This needs resolving before flooding occurs again, more properties and damaged and lives are lost.
Recommendation 58 of the Pitt report will help to address this risk.

Recommendation 58: The
Government should implement the
legislative changes proposed in the
Environment Agency biennial report on
dam and reservoir safety through the
forthcoming flooding legislation.

Legislative changes proposed in the EA biennial report are as follows:

Better risk-based definition of a reservoir within the
Act;

Funded powers to act at reservoirs with no owner;

Mandatory post-incident reporting;

More flexible enforcement powers;

Better quality assurance of inspection reports;

Better enforcement powers for reservoir flood plans; and

Better regulation of disused mine and quarry tips
and canals.
